00021 /**
00022  * \file  PgfFile.h
00023  * \brief Headers for the PgfFile class.
00024  *        Read \link file-format-pgf the PgfFile format \endlink for an overview.
00025  *        Read \link file-format-tsv the TsvFile docs \endlink more about TsvFile.
00026  */
00027 
00028 
00029 #ifndef _PGF_FILE_H
00030 #define _PGF_FILE_H
00031 
00032 #include "file/TsvFile/TsvFile.h"
00033 //
00034 #include "util/Err.h"
00035 //
00036 
00037 namespace affx {
00038   class PgfFile;
00039 };
00040 
00041 /// This defines an object which has fields and some methods
00042 /// to make working with PGF files a snap.  Basicly we define
00043 /// user friendly method which map to TsvFile mothods.
00044 class affx::PgfFile {
00045 public:
00046 #ifndef SWIG
00047   /// If you want to work with the underling tsv: "pgf.m_tsv.method()"
00048   affx::TsvFile m_tsv;
00049 #endif
00050   // There isnt a "m_" prefix on these, as I want to seperate them out
00051   // from the "real" member variables. This will make it
00052   // easy for people to write "pgf.atom_id".
00053   // (No annoying prefix.)
00054 
00055   //#%header0=
00056   int probeset_id;            ///< pgf
00057   std::string probeset_type;  ///< pgf
00058   std::string probeset_name;  ///< pgf
00059   //#%header1=
00060   int atom_id;                ///< pgf
00061   //#%header2=
00062   int probe_id;               ///< pgf
00063   std::string probe_type;     ///< pgf
00064   int gc_count;               ///< pgf
00065   int probe_length;           ///< pgf
00066   int interrogation_position; ///< pgf
00067   std::string probe_sequence; ///< pgf
00068   int exon_position;          ///< pgf
00069 
00070   /// @brief     Create the PgfFile object
00071   PgfFile();
00072 
00073   /// @brief     Destroy a PgfFile object
00074   ~PgfFile();
00075 
00076   /// @brief     Make the normal bindings to the standard PGF slots
00077   void makePgfBindings();
00078   /// @brief     Open a PGF file
00079   /// @param     filename the pathname of the file
00080   /// @return    tsv_return_t
00081   int open(const std::string& filename);
00082   /// @brief     start the write of a PGF file.
00083   /// @param     filename
00084   /// @return    tsv_return_t
00085   int write(const std::string& filename);
00086   /// @brief     Close a PGF file
00087   /// @return    tsv_return_t
00088   int close();
00089   /// @brief     Rewind back to the start of the PGF data
00090   /// @return    tsv_return_t
00091   int rewind();
00092   /// @brief     Skip to the next probeset
00093   /// @return    TSV_LEVEL_LAST when out of probesets
00094   int next_probeset();
00095   /// @brief     Skip to the next atom, but not beyond
00096   /// @return    TSV_LEVEL_LAST when out of atoms
00097   int next_atom();
00098   /// @brief     Skip to the next probe, but not beyond
00099   /// @return    TSV_LEVEL_LAST when out of probes
00100   int next_probe();
00101   /// @brief     Define a tsv file as a PGF file.
00102   /// @param     tsv       pointer to tsv to define
00103   /// @return    tsv_return_t
00104   int defineFilePgf(TsvFile* tsv);
00105   /// @brief     Define this file as a pgf file
00106   /// @return    tsv_return_t
00107   int defineFilePgf();
00108 
00109   /// @brief     Get a ptr for SWIG
00110   /// @return    a pointer to the internal TSV file object
00111   affx::TsvFile* tsv_ptr();
00112 };
00113 
00114 #endif // TsvFile
